alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Ritchie; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Calhoun, Ritchie, southwestern Doddridge, northern Gilmer and central Wirt Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 823 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from 8 miles north of Glenville to near Grantsville. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrisville, Glenville, Elizabeth, Grantsville, Pennsboro, North Bend State Park, Ellenboro, Cairo, Pullman, Auburn, Cherry, Smithville, Mount Zion, Newberne, Big Springs, Berea, Brohard, Tanner, Macfarlan and Annamoriah. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 36 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
